title: HONOR Teases More AI Editing Software for the 400 Series
description: HONOR wants to animate your still photos. The post HONOR Teases More AI Editing Software for the 400 Series appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: HONOR wants to animate your still photos.
text: With the upcoming Honor 400 series phones just on the horizon, the company recently showed off a bit more of the devices’ AI editing features, which include a new AI Image to Video feature that’s built into the OS, in addition to AI-enhancements for photos. READ: Honor Teases its Upcoming 400 Series Phones As you can probably tell from its moniker, AI Image to Video lets users take photos of static images and turn them into animated clips. This works for uploaded photos as well, and uses Google’s Cloud technology to generate the five-second clips. While it somewhat leans into the “uncanny valley” territory a bit, it is pretty impressive as far as AI-based animation goes. https://phandroid.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/The-Cheat-with-the-Ace-of-Clubs.mp4 The Honor 400 series will feature a 200MP main camera, which the company says has been enhanced with AI-enhanced editing and imaging capabilities. The new devices will also feature a more premium approach to design. As for the rest of the hardware specs (as well as details such as pricing), fans will have to tune into Honor’s big launch event, which is scheduled to go live on May 22. A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart. html:
With the upcoming Honor 400 series phones just on the horizon, the company recently showed off a bit more of the devices’ AI editing features, which include a new AI Image to Video feature that’s built into the OS, in addition to AI-enhancements for photos.

READ: Honor Teases its Upcoming 400 Series Phones

As you can probably tell from its moniker, AI Image to Video lets users take photos of static images and turn them into animated clips. This works for uploaded photos as well, and uses Google’s Cloud technology to generate the five-second clips. While it somewhat leans into the “uncanny valley” territory a bit, it is pretty impressive as far as AI-based animation goes.

The Honor 400 series will feature a 200MP main camera, which the company says has been enhanced with AI-enhanced editing and imaging capabilities. The new devices will also feature a more premium approach to design. As for the rest of the hardware specs (as well as details such as pricing), fans will have to tune into Honor’s big launch event, which is scheduled to go live on May 22.

A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart.
